p: Nitazoxanide ( 89, Fig. 13 ) is another potent type I interferon inducer that has been used in humans for parasitic infections [132]. A synthetic nitrothiazolylâ€“salicylamide derivative exhibits broad-spectrum antiviral activities against both RNA and DNA viruses including canine CoV, influenza viruses, HBV, HCV, HIV, rotavirus, norovirus, and flaviviruses [132]. It has been evaluated in Phase II and Phase III clinical trials for the treatment of HCV infection and influenza and has a good safety profile 132, 140, 141.
